title: Charge distribution metal plate inside capacitor

content.question: A parallel-plate capacitor is connected to a battery. A thick metal plate is located between the plates of the capacitor, as shown above. Which of the following best shows the distribution of charge on the thick plate?

choices.label: Option A consists of a rectangle representing a thick metal plate and its charges. The figure shows 10 negative charges along the top of the plate, and 10 positive charges along the bottom of the plate.  The charges are closer together near the center of the plate, and some charge is on the right and left sides of the plate.

Option B consists of a rectangle representing a thick metal plate and its charges. Option B. The figure shows 10 positive charges along the top of the plate, and 10 negative charges along the bottom of the plate.  The charges are closer together near the center of the plate, and some charge is on the right and left sides of the plate.

Option C consists of a rectangle representing a thick metal plate and its charges. Option C. The figure shows 11 evenly spaced negative charges along the top of the plate, and 11 evenly space positive charges along the bottom of the plate. There are no charges on the right and left sides of the plate.

Option D consists of a rectangle representing a thick metal plate and its charges. Option D. The figure shows 11 evenly spaced positive charges along the top of the plate, and 11 evenly spaced negative charges along the bottom of the plate. There are no charges on the right and left sides of the plate.

content.answer: Option A consists of a rectangle representing a thick metal plate and its charges. The figure shows 10 negative charges along the top of the plate, and 10 positive charges along the bottom of the plate.  The charges are closer together near the center of the plate, and some charge is on the right and left sides of the plate.
